org.openimaj.content.slideshow

Class Slideshow

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.content.slideshow.Slideshow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SlideshowApplet, SlideshowApplication

    public abstract class Slideshow
extends Object
implements KeyListener
    Implementation of a slideshow made up of Slides. Binds the left and right arrow keys to forward/backward, 'q' to quit and 'f' to toggle fullscreen mode. If the current slide being displayed is also a KeyListener then keypresses other than these will be passed to the slide.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Slideshow

        public Slideshow(RootPaneContainer container,
         List<Slide> slides,
         int slideWidth,
         int slideHeight,
         BufferedImage background)
          throws IOException
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        container - the root window
        slides - the slides
        slideWidth - the width to display the slides
        slideHeight - the height to display the slides
        background - a background image to display behind the slides (the slides need to be transparent!)
        Throws:
        IOException - if the first slide can't be loaded
